xxl.core.spatial.geometries

Interface MultiCurve2D<T extends Curve2D>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of this collection's elements
    All Superinterfaces:
    Comparable<Geometry2D>, Geometry2D, GeometryCollection2D<T>, Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    MultiLineString2D<T>

    public interface MultiCurve2D<T extends Curve2D>
extends GeometryCollection2D<T>
    A MultiCurve2D is a one-dimensional GeometryCollection whose elements are Curves. In the SFS a MultiCurve is a non-instantiable class which defines a set of methods for its subclasses and is included for reasons of extensibility.

    Specifications of MultiCurve2D according to the SFS:
    • A MultiCurve is simple if and only if all of its elements are simple, the only intersections between any two elements occur at points that are on the boundaries of both elements.
    • The boundary of a MultiCurve is obtained by applying the mod 2 union rule: A point is in the boundary of a MultiCurve if it is in the boundaries of an odd number of elements of the MultiCurve.
    • A MultiCurve is closed if all of its elements are closed. The boundary of a closed MultiCurve is always empty.
    • A MultiCurve is defined as topologically closed.


    See Simple Feature Specification (pdf).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getLength()
      Returns the Length of this MultiCurve which is equal to the sum of the lengths of the element Curves.
      boolean isClosed()
      Returns true if this MultiCurve is closed
